p: Highly pathogenic coronavirus (CoV) infections are well‐established sources of previous epidemics in humans, i.e. severe acute respiratory syndrome CoV (SARS‐CoV) and Middle East respiratory syndrome CoV (MERS‐CoV). The novel CoV named SARS‐CoV‐2, which shares a highly homological sequence with SARS‐CoV, is responsible for the current COVID‐19 outbreak with more than 2 million patients diagnosed and over 146 000 deaths, which exceeds by far the total of SARS and MERS in 2002 and 2012, respectively [ 1, 2, 3].
